MXEBolcL.title: The effect of reduced-glutathione on preventing erectile dysfunction in diabetic rats
MXEBolcL.abstract: Objective To investigate the effect of reduced-glutathione on preventing erectile dysfunction in diabetic rats. Methods Male adult Sprague-Dawley rats were induced for diabetes by an intraperitoneal injection of streptozotocin, then randomly divided into DM group and DM+GSH group. The rats in DM+GSH group were treated with GSH at a dosage of 200mg/kg through a intramuscular injection every day. Ten weeks later the erectile function of all these rats were evaluated,and their penises harvested. The GSH, NOS and MDA level in corpus cavernosum were measured;and TUNEL assay was used to analyse the penile cells for apoptosis. Results The diabetic rat model was successfully established. The erectile function was much better in normal control group(group C, 100%)and DM+GSH group(62.5%) than DM group (20%), P<0.05. The glutathione level in DM group was significantly decreased (35.03±12.29)mg/g prot, compared to group C (61.47±8.65)mg/g prot and DM+GSH group (75.83±15.62)mg/g prot, P<0.05. The NOS level was approximately equal in DM+GSH group(133.9±31.9)U/mg prot and group C (142.2±31.2)U/mg prot, both much higher than in DM group (58.4±18.9)U/mg prot, P<0.05. The malondialdehyde content in corpus cavernosum was markedly increased in DM group (3.71±0.62)nmol/mg prot, compared to group C (2.08±0.34)nmol/mg prot and DM+GSH group(2.44±0.28)nmol/mg prot, P<0.05. TUNEL showed significantly differences in apoptosis in these groups, and the apoptosis rate in DM group, DM+GSH group and group C were (22.6±3.6)%, (10.8±1.7)% and (7.2±2.1)%, respectively. Conclusion The reduced-glutathione has the effect of antioxidation on diabetic rats’ penis tissues,which can decrease the apoptosis of corpus cavernosum cells, and may play some role in delaying the onset of diabetic erectile dysfunction.

FGGbGT94.title: Vascular endothelial growth factor antisense oligonucleotides inhibition of bladder carcinoma in nude mice mediated by ultrasound microbubble
FGGbGT94.abstract: Objective: To investigate the effect of inhibition of vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF) antisense oligonucleotides (ASODN) on human bladder carcinoma in nude mice mediated by ultrasound microbubble. Methods: Twenty-four mice were randomly divided into 4 groups (each n=6) when transplantation tumor was established, and different materials were injected into the mice through caudal veins: Circled digit oneUM+ASODN group: mixture of microbubble and VEGF ASODN plus ultrasound irradiation of local tumor; Circled digit twoliposome + ASODN group: mixture of liposome and VEGF-ASODN; Circled digit threeUM group: microbubble plus local irradiation with the same condition; and Circled digit fourcontrol group: normal saline. The treatment was performed every 3 d with total 5 times. The volume change of mouse subcutane tumors was observed. The expression of VEGF, CD34 and Ki67 with immunohistochemistry dyeing were evaluated, and the microvessel density (MVD) and cell proliferation index were calculated. TUNEL assay was used to analyze the apoptosis of tumor cells. Results: The growth speed of nude mice tumor in UM+ASODN group was obviously slower than that in control group; the expression of VEGF and the MVD in UM+ASODN group was lower than that in control group (P<.0.05), while compared with control group, the apoptosis of tumor in UM+ASODN group increased (P< 0.01), but the proliferation of tumor in UM+ASODN group de creased (P< 0.05). Conclusion: VEGF antisense oligonucleotides mediated by ultrasound microbubbe can efficiently inhibit the growth of human bladder carcinoma in nude mice.

eyuRxPJO.title: Antisense oligonucleotide targeting Livin induces apoptosis of human bladder cancer cell via a mechanism involving caspase 3.
eyuRxPJO.abstract: in recent years, Livin, a new member of IAPs family, is found to be a key molecule in cancers. Researchers consider Livin may become a new target for tumor therapy; however, the role of it in bladder cancer is still unclear. The purpose of this article is to investigate Antisense Oligonucleotide (ASODN) of Livin on treating bladder cancer cell and underlying mechanisms.Phosphorathioate modifying was used to synthesize antisense oligonucleotides targeting Livin, followed by transfection into human bladder cancer cell 5637. After transfection, Livin mRNA and protein level, cell proliferation and apoptosis changes, caspase3 level and its effect on human bladder cancer transplantable tumor in nude mice were measured.results showed Livin ASODN effectively inhibited Livin expression and tumor cell proliferation, and these effects probably through enhanced caspase3 activity and apoptosis of tumor cells. In nude mice transplantable tumor model, Livin expressions were inhibited meanwhile caspase3 expression was increased. Tumor growth slowed down and apoptosis was enhanced.Our data suggest that Livin plays an important role in inhibiting apoptosis of bladder cancer cells. Livin ASODN may promote cell apoptosis, inhibit bladder cancer growth, and become one of the methods of gene therapy for bladder cancer.

JvIMVobr.title: Ultrasonic microbubbles destruction combining endothelial progenitor cells for improvement of erectile function in rats with diabetic erectile dysfunction
JvIMVobr.abstract: Objective: To explore the feasibility of improving the delivery of endothelial progenitor cells (EPCs) to cavernosum tissue for the treating rat diabetes-induced erectile dysfunction by using ultrasonic microbubble destruction. Methods: EPCs were derived from mouse bone marrow in vitro. Fifty-four SD rats were successfully induced into models of diabetes mellitus induced erectile dysfunction (DMED) and were randomly divided into 3 groups, i. e. control group, EPCs group and 1.0 W/cm 2 ultrasound + microbubbles + EPCs (US + MB + EPCs) group. All the rats were sacrificed 7 days after EPCs implantation. The number of penile erections and erection rate were induced by apomorphine (APO), and the vascular density of 3 groups was recorded after HE staining. EPCs expression was detected using immunohistochemistry, and VEGF protein was respectively detected with Western blot. Results: Penile erections, erection rate, vascular density and EPCs expression were the best in US + MB + EPCs group (P < 0.05). And the expression of VEGF protein in US + MB + EPCs group was higher than that in two other groups (all P < 0.05). Conclusion: Combination of ultrasound microbubbles and EPCs can enhance the transfection efficiency and targeting of EPCs effectively, therefore improve the erectile function of DMED rats. WE8rVKQZ.title: Study on the effect of VDR and its Ligand(BXL-35)in the SD rat model with chronic abacterial prostatitis
WE8rVKQZ.abstract: Objective To investigate the expression of vitamin D receptor in prostate tissue of rat model with chronic abacterial prostatitis and explore treatment value of VDR Ligands(BXL-35) for chronic abacterial prostatitis Methods Total of sixty 10-month-old male Sprague-Dawley rats were randomly divided into three groups including the control group(20 rats),the rat model group with chronic abacterial prostatitis(20 rats) and treated rat model group with VDR Ligand(BXL-35)(20rats).The mRNA expression of VDR in prostatic tissue was detected by RTPCR .The levels of TNF-á,IFN-γ,NF-kB and IkBáwere analyzed by Imunohistochemistry(SABC) for evaluating the effect of BXL-35 on chronic abacterial prostatitis.Results(1) The expression of VDRmRNA in the rat model group with chronic ahacterial prostatitis were lower than that in the control group and treated rat model group(P<0.01);(2) Compared with those in the rat model group with chronic abacterial prostatitis,the level of TNF-á,IFN-γand NF-kB decreased significantly in the treated rat model group(P<0.01),but the level of Ik Báincreased(P<0.01).Conclusion VDR might play an important role in the pathological meachnism of chronic abacterial prostatitis.VDR ligand BXL-35 could ameliorate nonbacterial chronic prostatitis and might be a new treatment for chronic abacterial prostatitis.

lmAux9xH.title: Antisense oligonucleotide targeting livin induces apoptosis of human renal carcinoma cell 786-O in vitro and its mechanism
lmAux9xH.abstract: Objective To investigate the effect of antisense oligonucleotides (ASODN) targeting livin on the inhibition of livin mRNA and protein expression and the apoptosis of human renal carcinoma cell line 786-O cells. Methods Specific phosphorothioate antisense oligodeoxynucleotides targeting livin were synthesized and then transfected into 786-O cells. The expressions of livin mRNA were detected by RT-PCR. Expression and location of livin protein were observed by confocal laser scanning microscope (CLSM). Apoptosis rate of 786-O cells was investigated by flow cytometer. The activity of Caspase-3 was detected by colorimetric assay. Results After the transfection of ASODN, the expression of livin mRNA was decreased (P<0.01), the fluorescence signal of livin protein observed by CLSM was significantly decreased, the apoptosis rates detected by flow cytometry were significantly increased (P<0.01), and the caspase-3 activity was enhanced (P<0.01). Conclusion Livin ASODN could remarkably down-regulate the expression of livin gene in 786-O cells line and induce tumor cell apoptosis. These events are linked to the activation of caspase-3.

aueBilFL.title: The Effect of Simultaneous Transurethral Resection of Bladder Tumor and Prostate on the Tumor Recurrence and Implantation(Meta Analysis)
aueBilFL.abstract: Objective:To assess the efficacy and safety of simultaneous resection in the treatment of superficial bladder cancer(SBC) with benign prostatic hyperplasia(BPH).Methods:Combined overseas and domestic published data from comparative studies on simultaneous TURBT and TURP versus TBRBt alone in SBC were retrieved, and the data of eligible studies were pooled(meta-analysis).Odds ratios(OR) and 95%con? dence intervals (CI) were used as the primary effect size to estimate the outcome of tumor recurrence,recurrence in bladder neck/prostatic fossa.Results:ln six eligible clinical trials,377 patients were treated with simultaneous resection and 384 with TURBT alone.Within the follow-up period,36.3%(137/377)of patients in the simultaneous group and 46.3%(178/384) of the patients in the control group developed tumor recurrence,the combined analysis showed the recurrence of simultaneous group statistically signi? cant lower than control group in the overall pooled data(OR 0.63,95%CI 0.47-0.86);19(5%) of 377 patients in simultaneous group and 18(4.7%) of 384 patients in control group developed tumor recurrence in bladder neck/prostatic fossa,no statistically signi? cant was found in two groups(OR 1.09,95%CI 0.55-2.14).Conclusion:The evidence from this formal meta-analysis suggests that simultaneous TURBT and TURP have decreased the incidence of overall tumor recurrence,while no effect on incidence of implantation in bladder neck/prostatic fossa.

OlcbMWRa.title: Effects of Shi Zi Er Xian decoction on sperm acrosomal integrity and DNA integrity in patients after varicocelectomy
OlcbMWRa.abstract: Objective To investigate the effects of Shi Zi Er Xian Decoction on sperm acrosomal integrity and DNA integrity in patients with kidney yang deficiency after varicocelectomy. Methods Pretesting of the integrity of sperm acrosomal integrity and DNA of 20 normal sperm samples were carried out as reference data. In total 60 varicocele patients with kidney yang deficiency collected from the Reproductive Center of our hospital from April 2008 to January 2011 were randomly divided into the treatment group (30 cases, given Shi Zi Er Xian Decoction) and control group (30 cases, given L-carnitine). The semen samples were collected 1 week before surgery and 3 months after surgery. All the treatments lasted for 3 months without stop. Three months later, the patients who did not respond well to the treatment (DFI≥15 and acrosomal integrity<90%) underwent drug withdrawal for one week. Then, the treatment programs were exchanged, lasting for one course again. Results After one course of treatment, the sperm density, motility, DFI and acrosomal integrity of both groups were all improved. The sperm motility, DFI and acrosomal integrity of the treatment group were better than those of the control group (P<0.05), but the sperm density had no significant difference between them(P>0.05). After the treatment programs were exchanged, better effect was found in the group given the Shi Zi Er Xian Decoction than that in the control group(P<0.05). Conclusion The Shi Zi Er Xian Decoction is able to reduce sperm DFI in patients with kidney yang deficiency and improve acrosomal integrity.

1ztnAbPF.title: Effect of memory alloy intrauterine contraceptive device containing cooper and indomethacin on histomorphology of rabbit endometrium and its important organs
1ztnAbPF.abstract: Objective:To explore the histomorphological changes of endometrium and important organs in rabbits inserted with memory alloy intrauterine contraceptive devices(IUDs)containing combinations of cooper and indomethacin.Methods:Female Japanese white rabbits were randomly divided into three groups,study group(n=18,inserted with memory alloy IUD),control group(n=18,inserted with stainless steel IUD containing cooper and indomethacin)and blank control group(n=6).IUDs were inserted into uterine cavity of these rabbits.All rabbits were sacrificed at 1,3,6 month(s)after the operation.The uterus,fallopian tubes,ovaries,hearts,lungs,livers,spleens and kidneys were collected.The specimens underwent HE staining and slicing and were examined under the light microscope.Results:The main pathological changes of the regions compressed directly included the expanded uterine cavity,the thin mucosal layer,and reduced mucosal folds in the study and control groups.Light extension and hyperemia of small vessels were observed in uterine walls of all groups,showing no significant differences among the three groups.No obvious abnormal changes were found in the specimens of heart,lung,liver,spleen and kidney.Conclusion:These two kinds of IUDs have similar effects on histomorphology of rabbit endometrium and important organs.

8Gwq93O2.title: Effects of α-1 ipoic acid on the expressions of cytoskeleton proteins in the oxidative stress-induced sertoli cells
8Gwq93O2.abstract: Objective To explore the effects of a -1ipoic acid on the expression of cytoskeleton proteins in the oxidative stress-induced sertoli cells. Methods Primary rat sertoli cells were randomly divided into four groups including control group, LA(200μmol/L) group, H 2O 2(400 μmol/L) group and H 2O 2 plus LA pretreatment group. Cell viability was assessed by CCK-8. Intracellular reactive oxygen species (ROS) were measured by the fluorescent probe DCFH-DA. The activities of antioxidant enzymes were measured by enzyme activity detection kit. The expressions of vimentin and a-tubulin were detected by immunohistochemistry and Western blot. Results Compared with those of the control group, cell viability was decreased, intracellular ROS was increased, activities of antioxidant enzymes were decreased and the expressions of vimentin and a-tubulin were downregulated in sertoli cells after the stimulation of H 2O 2(P<0.05). However, by LA pretreatment, cell viability was improved, activities of antioxidant enzymes were enhanced, intracellular ROS level was decreased, and the expressions of vimentin and α-tubulin were upregulated (P <0.05). Conclusion H 2O 2 might induce the expressions of vimentin and a-tubulin in sertoli cells and its cell survival rate. The protective role of LA might amend this damage by eliminating intracellular ROS, improving the activities of antioxidant enzymes, and upregulating the expressions of vimentin and α-tubulin.

tuNd1QFk.title: Non-invasive Ablation of Pig Bladder Tissue Using High Intensity Focused Ultrasound:Experimental Study
tuNd1QFk.abstract: Objective To investigate the feasibility of treating superficial bladder tumor with high intensity focused ultrasound(HIFU).Methods The bladder walls of 16 miniswine were irradiated with HIFU at intensity of 5832 W/cm~2 20 seconds for each target point.The irradiation effects on bladders were monitored by diagnostic ultrasound.Animals were killed within 1 hour,4 and 8 weeks after irradiation.Results HIFU penetrated the skin and precisely damaged bladder walls.Bright echoes were observed on diagnostic ultrasound in the acute lesions,but 5 minutes later,these echoes disappeared and 10 minutes later,the irradiated bladder walls became thickened.Epithelial denudation and irreversible submucosal and superficial muscular lesions were very clear under macroscopy and microscopy.Eight weeks later,the urothelium,submucosa and superficial muscles healed and replaced by fibrous connective tissues in all animals.Conclusions HIFU is a safe and effective non-invasive treatment option for superficial bladder tumors.

d7iK3n9Z.title: The difference of smooth muscle and elastic fiber between in adults prepuce and in children pepuce
d7iK3n9Z.abstract: Objective To study the difference of smooth muscle and elastic fiber between in adult prepuce and in children prepuce.Methods Distribution of smooth muscle cells and the content of elastic fiber in adult prepuce and children prepuce were measured respectively by immunohistochemistry and Weigert-stained.Results The number of smooth muscle cells in adult prepuce was lower than that in children prepuce,whereas the content of elastic fiber in adult prepuce was higher.No difference in the number of smooth muscle cells and the content of elastic fiber was found between phimosis group and redundant prepuce group.Conclusion Smooth muscle cells and elastic fiber might play an important role in the development of physiological phimosis.No direct relationship was found between smooth muscle cells orelastic fiber and the occur of adult phimosis.

h6C9V8Ma.title: Effect of inflammation on seminal parameters in patients with chronic prostatitis/chronic pelvic pain syndrome
h6C9V8Ma.abstract: Objective To investigate the effect of chronic prostatitis/chronic pelvic pain syndrome(CP/CPPS) on the seminal parameters such as sperm concentration,normal sperm morphology,vitality and progressive motility.Methods One hundred and twenty-three patients with definitely diagnosed CP/CPPS(ⅢA type 61 cases,ⅢB type 62 cases) were undergone seminal parameter test and 55 patients were used as control.Results Progressive motility and vitality had no statistical difference between both groups(P>0.05),NIH ⅢA and NIH ⅢB.However,in the patient′s group the sperm concentration and normal sperm morphology(P<0.05) were significantly lower as compared with the control.Conclusion The data presented in this study reveal that sperm concentration and normal sperm morphology are significantly compromised in patients with chronic prostatitis,no matter if this disease is inflammatory(NIH ⅢA) or non-inflammatory(NIH ⅢB).

qRjUAnKx.title: Clinical features analysis of simple BPH and BPH with CP
qRjUAnKx.abstract: Objective To analyze the differences in clinical features of simple BPH and BPH with CP. Methods The clinical data of patients who underwent TURP from 2005 to 2010 were retrospectively analyzed. The significant differences in ages,clinic features,volume of prostate,IPSS score,serum prostate specific antigen,etc were statistically analyzed by SPSS17.0.Results Simple BPH patients were admitted due to urinary frequency,while patients who accompanying with CP were admitted due to pain or terminal dribbling;There were no differences in ages,prostate volume and PSA,whereas a significant difference in IPSS between simple BPH patients and BPH patients with CP .Conclusion Pain or terminal dribbling or IPSS scores might be important indexes to discriminate simple BPH from BPH with CP.Patients with IPSS score over 25 should be considered as occurrence of prostatitis.

IPfgKK7s.title: Clinical study of Tripterygium in the treatment of ⅢB Refractory Chronic Prostatitis
IPfgKK7s.abstract: Objective To explore the effect of Tripterygium in the treatment of ⅢB Refractory Chronic Prostatitis.Methods All the patients were scored on NIH-CPSI and investigated the levels of IFN-γ,IL-10 in Expressed Proststic Fluid(EPS) in the pre-and post-treatment.Results With in post-treatment,the total score on NIH-CPSI and that on NIH-CPSI pain symtoms were significantly improved(P<0.01),the score on NIH-CPSI pain symptoms was more significantly improved(P<0.001).The levels of IFN-γ in EPS were significantly decreased(P<0.01) and that of IL-10 were more significantly improved.Conclusion The treatment of Tripterygium is effective for ⅢB Refractory Chronic Prostatitis.

liHUoCpy.title: One-stage pneumatic lithotripsy and transurethral resection of the prostate for benign prostatic hyperplasia and bladder stone
liHUoCpy.abstract: Objective To investigate the results of pneumatic lithotripsy followed by transurethral resection of the prostate(TURP) in patients with benign prostatic hyperplasia(BPH) and bladder stone.Methods A total of 49 patients with benign prostatic hyperplasia and bladder stone underwent ballistic lithotripsy followed by TURP.Results All calculi were fragmented with the ballistic Swiss Lithoclast,without scattered engorge and edema occurring in mucous membrane of bladder during lithotripsy.No vesical perforation,stone recurrence,incontinence and urethral stricture were complicated.Conclusion The combination of pneumatic lithotripsy and TURP seems to be an effective,safe,and economical treatment method for patients with bladder stone(s) and BPH.

t7bKLkU0.title: The clinical analysis of simplified bladder irrigation in eliminating bladder blood clots
t7bKLkU0.abstract: Objective To study the clinical effects of simplified bladder irrigation in eliminating bladder blood clots.Methods Retrospective study of 52 cases of bladder blood clot.Adopt simplified bladder irrigation eliminate blood clots in the bladder,after the technique,the constant temperature physiological saline was used for continuous bladder irrigation.Results Blood clots were successfully eliminated,cystoscopy were carried out smoothly,the recurrence rate of blood clots was lower than conventional methods.Conclusion Simplified bladder irrigation can effectively and safely eliminate blood clots within the bladder,it was significantly improved compared with conventional methods(P<0.05).

yaGmQmA5.title: Impact of continuous taking low-dose Aspirin on bleeding complications after transrectal ultrasound-guided biopsy of the prostate
yaGmQmA5.abstract: Objective: To observe the impact of continuous taking low-dose Aspirin on bleeding complications after transrectal ultrasound (TRUS)-guided biopsy of the prostate. Methods: Ninety-six patients taking Aspirin longer than 3 months and 104 patients not taking Aspirin over 1 week before prostate biopsy were analyzed. The incidence of bleeding complications and duration of bleeding were compared between two groups. Results: Severe postoperative bleeding was not found in the two groups. No significant difference for hematuria, rectal bleeding or hematospermia after TRUS-guided biopsy of the prostate was found (all P>0.05), but the duration of bleeding was statistically different between the two groups (P<0.01). Conclusion: Continuous taking of low-dose Aspirin does not increase the incidence of mild bleeding complications, although it prolongs the duration of self-limiting hematuria and rectal bleeding after TRUS-guided biopsy of the prostate.

98o8ecTz.title: The effect of ultrasound-mediated microbubble on the therapy of nonbacterial chronic prostatitis in rat model
98o8ecTz.abstract: Objective To enhance medicine concentration in rat prostate to get better therapeutic effect by taking use of the"sound aperture effect"and site-targeted effect of ultrasound-Mediated albumin microbubble.Methods Total of 40 one-year-old male Sprague-Dawley rats were divided into five groups randomly,normal group,model group,ultrasound-mediated albumin microbubble group,cernilton group and ultrasound-mediated microbubble plus cernilton group.Different treatment and therapy were given to different group.After 30d,the prostate weight,pathological changes,IL-1β,IL-6 and TNF-αin prostate were measured.Results The wet prostate weight in cernilton group and ultrasound-mediated albumin Microbubble plus cernilton group became significantly lower than that in the model group(P<0.01).In comparision with that in the model group,pathologic characteristics of chronic inflammation was ameliorated significantly in the cernilton group and the ultrasound-mediated albumin microbubble plus cernilton group,especially in the ultrasound-mediated albumin microbubble plus cemilton group.The expression of IL-1β,IL-6 and TNF-αin cernilton group and ultrasound-mediated albumin microbubble plus cernilton group decreased compared with that in model group(P<0.01).The level of IL-1β,IL-6 and TNF-αin ultrasound-Mediated Microbubble plus cernilton group were lower than that in cernilton group(P<0.05).Conclusion The treatment of nonbacterial chronic prostatitis might be improved by enhancing the concentration of drug in prostate with ultrasound-mediated microbubble.

6UY3GcPt.title: Expression of transforming growth factor-beta(1) and connective tissue growth factor in the prostate tissue of rat model of chronic nonbacterial prostatitis
6UY3GcPt.abstract: Objective: To study the expression of transforming growth factor-beta(1)(TGF-β1) and connective tissue growth factor(CTGF) in the prostate tissue of rat model with chronic nonbacterial prostatitis(CNP) and the mechanism of CNP and its fibrosis. Methods: 45 aged SpragueDawley rats were randomly divided into three groups: the control group(15 rats), the rat model of CNP group(non becterial chronic prostatitis, 15 rats)and the rat model treated group, group [CNP treated with sinomenine(SIN), 15 rats]. The expression of TGF- β1 and CTGF in rat prostatic tissue was detected by immunohistochemistry(sp). Results: (1) The changes in histopathology and pathophysiology in the established animal model were similar to those in clinical CNP; (2)The expression level of TGF- β1 and CTGF in the rat model group with CNP were higher than those in the control group (P<0.01); (3)As compared with those in the rat model for CNP group, the expression with of TGF- β1 and CTGF in the rat model treated group (P<0.01); (4)A significant positive correlation existed between the expression of TGF- β1 and that of CTGF in the CNP rats(r=0.99, P<0.01). Conclusion: The TGF- β1 and CTGF maybe play an important role in the development of the CNP and its fibrosis of the CNP. SIN maybe a new treatment for the CNP and prevention of its fibrosis.

m5UahC5N.title: High ligation of varicocele improves sperm DNA integrity in patients with asthenospermia
m5UahC5N.abstract: Objective: To assess how high ligation of varicocele improves sperm DNA integrity in patients with asthenospermia. Methods: The DNA fragmentation index (DFI) and semen analysis were conducted in 30 subjects with normal sperm samples, and the parameters were used as references. Fifty-six patients from the Department of Urology of the Second Affiliated Hospital of Chongqing Medical University from April 2009 to April 2011 all signed the informed consent, Semen was collected 1 week before the high ligation of varicocele and 3 months after the surgery. We compared the change of the integrity of sperm DNA and semen. Results: Three months after the high ligation of varicocele, DFI and semen indexes significantly improved (P<0.05), but no significant difference was found between open surgery and laparoscopic surgery, unilateral varicocele and bilateral varicocele and Grade I, Grade II, Grade III varicocele (P>0.05). Six months later, 27 spouses were pregnant out of the 53 surgical patients (50.9%). DFI of the pregnancy group and the non-pregnancy group was (13.90±9.70)% and (20.10±10.27)%, with significant different (P<0.05). Conclusion: Varicocelectomy can improve the sperm DNA integrity in patients with asthenospermia, whose effect is not related to surgical approach, unilateral or bilateral varicocele or varicocele grade.

fSKu69CT.title: Benign prostate hyperplasia with chronic prostatitis: an update]
fSKu69CT.abstract: Benign prostate hyperplasia (BPH) and chronic prostatitis (CP) are common diseases in males, and BPH is often complicated by CP. This review focuses on the relationship of BPH with CP and their epidemiology, pathogenesis and clinical features. Patients with BPH or CP are more likely to be subjected to another disease. Inflammation may be involved in the development of BPH. Compared with simple BPH, patients with CP-complicated BPH have significantly higher scores on age, prostate weight, prostate volume, and IPSS. Some related therapies are also evaluated, such as selective use of the alpha1-receptor blocker, 5alpha-reductase inhibitor, antibiotics, ultrasound microbubble contrast agents, and so on.

XqWLUjyH.title: A multicenter,randomized controlled,double-blind clinical trial of piperacillin/tazobactam(4∶1) in the treatment of bacterial infections
XqWLUjyH.abstract: Objective To evaluate the efficacy and safety of domestic piperacillin/tazobactam(4∶1) in the treatment of acute bacterial infections of the respiratory and urinary tract. Methods A multicenter double-blind randomized clinical trials was conducted to compare the efficacy and safety of domestic piperacillin/tazobactam (4∶1) and piperacillin/tazobactam (8∶1) in the treatment of bacterial infections. piperacillin/tazobactam (4∶1) and piperacillin/tazobactam (8∶1) were administered intravenously each time at a dose of 2.5g or 2.25g respectiv ely, and given twice daily for 5 to 14 days. Results A total of 266 patients were enrolled in the study. In the treatment group and control group, there were 124 patients and 127 patients enrolled in FAS analysis, while 122 patients and 126 patients were eligible for PPS analysis. At the end of treatment, the cure rates and efficacy rates were 61.48%and 87.70%in the trial group, while 59.52%and 88.89%in the control group. The bacterial eradication rates were 93.94%and 92.10%, adverse reactions rates were 11.94%and 12.88%, drug-related clinical adverse reactions were 5.97%and 9.09%, respectively. There were no statistical differences between the two groups (P>0.05). Conclusion Domestic injectable piperacillin/tazobactam (4∶1) was as effective and safe as piperacillin/tazobactam(8:1) in the treatment of respiratory and urinary tract infections.

FDqJdtpi.title: Effect of Copper Contained Memory Alloy Intrauterine Contraceptive Device on Ultrastructure of Rabbit Endometrium
FDqJdtpi.abstract: Objective: To investigate the effect of copper contained memory alloy intrauterine contraceptive device(IUD) on ultrastructure of rabbit endometrium.Methods: Female oryctolagus cuniculus were randomly divided into 3 groups,copper contained memory alloy IUD group(n=18),copper contained stainless steel IUD group(n=18) and sham-operation control group(n=6).IUD was placed into uterine cavity through operation.All rabbits were sacrificed at 1,3,6 months after operation.The uterus were taken out.The endometrium in the IUD placement location was examined under scanning and transmission electron microscope.Results: Under scanning electron microscope,the morphology changes of epithelium were increased with the time of IUD placement and compression level.The epithelium cells gradually presented cell surface flatten,epithelium and microvillus sparseness,disappear.The epithelium cells presented damage and desquamation with long time IUD placement.Under transmission electron microscope,the morphology changes of epithelium were similar in 2 kinds of IUD placement groups.The main changes were endoplasmic reticulum extension,nuclear swelling,plasmolemma dissolution and epithelium cells desquamation in severe cases.The damage of ultrastructure were increase with the time of IUD placement and compression level.However,the damage of basement membrane were light and the stroma under basement membrane presented no significant morphological changes.Conclusion: The effect of copper contained memory alloy IUD and copper contained stainless steel IUD on ultrastructure of rabbit endometrium were similar.

EQ44zuxd.title: The influence of α-MSH on the expression of HMGB1 in prostate tissue of the rat model with chronic nonbacterial prostatitis
EQ44zuxd.abstract: Objective: To explore the role of HMGB l in the rat model of chronic nonbacterial prostatitis and the mechanism of treatment of chronic nonbacterial prostatitis by α-MSH. Methods Thirty aged Sprague Dawley rats were randomly divided into three groups including the control group(1 Orats), the untreated group(10 rats) and the α - MSH treated group(l Orats). Pathology changes of prostate tissues were analyzed by H.E staining. The expression of HMGB1, TNF-α and IL-10 were detected by immunohistochmistry and Western blot. Results: (1) The pathological changes in prostate tissue of rat models were resembled with the characteristics of chronic nonbacterial prostatitis; (2) The expression of HMGB1 in the model groups was significantly higher than that in the normal control group; (3) The expressions of HMGB1 and TNF-α in the α-MSH treated group were significantly decresed(P<0.01); (4) The expression of IL-10 in the α-MSH treated group was significantly higher than that in the untreated group. Conclusion: HMGB1 might be involved in the pathogenesis of chronic nonbacterial prostatitis. α-MSH could be a new treatment option of chronic nonbacterial prostatitis by inhibiting the expression of inflammatory cytokines and promoting antiinflammatory cytokines.

p87d7dEr.title: The Influence of Tripterygium wilfodil polyglucosidinm(TWP) on the expression of NF-κB and iNOS in the rat model of nonbacterial chronic prostatitis
p87d7dEr.abstract: Objective To explore the influence of tripterygium polyglucoside on the expression of NF-κB and iNOS in the rat model of nonbacterial chronic prostatitis.Methods Thirty aged SpragueDawley rats were randomly divided into three groups:the control group(10 rats),the untreated group(rat model of nonbacterial chronic prostatitis,10 rats)and the treated group(rat model of nonbacterial chronic prostatitis treated with TWP group,10 rats).The amount of WBC and lecithin body in prostate tissue were measured and the expressions of NF-κB and iNOS mRNA in rat Prostate tissue were detected.Results(1) Compared with that in the control group,the amount of WBC increased untreated group(P<0.01) and the density of lecithin body decreased(P<0.05).The mRNA expressions of NF-κB and iNOS were upregulated in untreated group in comparision with that in control group(P<0.01);(2)Compared with that in untreated group,the amount of WBC decreasedin treated group(P<0.01) and the density of the lecithin body increased(P<0.05).There were obvious differences in the mRNA expressions of NF-κB and iNOS between the treated goup and the untreated group(P<0.01).Conclusion The iNOS and NF-κB might be involved in the development of the nonbacterial chronic prostatitis.TWP could be used for the treatment of nonbacterial chronic prostatitis.

gq1J0qZ3.title: Experimental study on protective effect of PPARr Ligands (Pioglitazone) on nonbacterial chronic prostatitis
gq1J0qZ3.abstract: Objective: (1) To investigate the expression of peroxisome proliferators-actived receptor-γ (PPAR-γ) in the rat model with nonbacterial chronic prostatitis and evaluate its significance. (2) to investigate protective effect of PPAR-γ Ligands (Pioglitazone) in the rat model for nonbacterial chronic prostatitis and to study its possible mechanism. Methods: 45 aged SpragueDawley rats were randomly divided into three groups: the control group (15 rats), the rat model group (15 rats, nonbacterial chronic prostatitis) and the rat model group (15 rats, nonbacterial chronic prostatitis treated with Pioglitazone). The expression of PPAR-γ in rat prostatic tissue was detected by means of RT-PCR, and the expression of NF-κB, IL-1β and TNF-α were measured to judge protective effect of Pioglitazone in the rat model for nonbacterial chronic prostatitis. Results: (1) The PPAR-γ in the rat model for nonbacterial chronic prostatitis group were higher than the control group; (2) As compared with those in the rat model with nonbacterial chronic prostatitis group, the expression level of NF-κB, IL-1β and TNF-α in the rat model for nonbacterial chronic prostatitis treated with Pioglitazone group was abated (P < 0.01). Conclusion: PPAR-γ might play a role in the pathophysiology of non-bacterial chronic prostatitis. PPAR-γ ligands Pioglitazone could ameliorate nonbacterial chronic prostatitis, which may be associated with suppression the expression of NF-êB. PPAR-γ ligands. It maybe a new treatment for the nonbacterial chronic prostatitis.

5ZciAWpo.title: Experimental study on protective effect of Heme oxygenase-1 (HO-1) ligand in the rat model with nonbacterial chronic prostatitis
5ZciAWpo.abstract: Objective: To investigate the expression of Heme oxygenase-1 (HO-1) in the rat model with nonbacterial chronic prostatitis and explore its possible meachnism. Methods Total of 45 SpragueDawley rats were randomly divided into the control group(15 rats), the rat model group with nonbacterial chronic prostatitis (15 rats) and the treated rat model group with Hemin (15 rats). The expression of HO-1 in rat prostatic tissue was detected by RT-PCR., and the expressions of NF-κB, IκB α and TNF-α were detected by immunohistochemistry. Results: (1) The expresssion of HO-1 in the rat model group was significantly lower than that of the control group and the treated rat group (P<0.05). (2) Compared with those in the rat model group, the expressions of NF-κ B and TNF-α in the treated rat model obviously decreased (P<0.05), whereas the expression of I κB a significantly increased (P<0.05). Conclusion: HO-1 might be involved in the pathological development of nonbacterial chronic prostatitis. HO-1 ligands Hemin could ameliorate pathological symptom of nonbacterial chronic prostatitis.

Io0QtVE5.title: The effect of ultrasound microbubble on permeability of rat prostate
Io0QtVE5.abstract: Objective To investigate the effect of ultrasound microbubble on the permeability of rat prostate. Methods Twenty-four SD rats were randomly divided into three groups: BPH group, UM+BPH group and the control group. After injected with albumin ultrasound contrast, the rats in UM+BPH group were treated with ultrasound irradiation by using the UGT 1025 type gene transfection instrument. The change of prostatic blood vessel and cellular membrane were observed under electron microscope. The prostatic index (PI) was calculated and the content of trypan blue per 100 mg prostatic tissue determined by using spectrophotometry. Results The weaker capillary basement membrane, leakage of red blood cells from capillary, epithelium becoming sparse and cavitations in the mitochondrium were observed in UM+BPH group. The PI were higher in BPH group (2.88±0.03) and UM+BPH group (2.88±0.02) than in the control group (1.57±0.04) (P<0.05). The content of trypan blue per 100 mg prostatic tissue was higher in UM+BPH group [(8.54±0.23)×10-9g/L] than in BPH group [(2.54±0.11)×10-9g/L] and in the control group [(4.20±0.22)×10-9g/L] (P<0.05). Conclusion The permeability of prostatic tissue was decreased in rats with BPH, while increased by using the radiation of ultrasound microbubble.

agiflBQz.title: Desmoplastic small round cell tumor: report of 2 cases]
agiflBQz.abstract: To recognize the characteristics of desmoplastic small round cell tumor (DSRCT) and improve the standard of diagnosis.We retrospectively reviewed the clinical data on the treatment of 2 patients with DSRCT in terms of their conditions, tissue sources, pathologic characteristics, immunohistochemical methods, clinical manifestation, diagnosis, treatment and prognosis.Clinical manifestations were complicated. The 2 patients were mis diagnosed before operation. Their tumors consisted of irregular nests of small and round cells, with nuclear hyperchromatism and scant cytoplasm embedded in a plenty of fibrous connective tissues. The edge of the nest was clear, with different sizes and shapes. Immunohistochemically, the 2 patients were positive for CK or EMA, NSE, des and vim of the epithelium, nerve, muscle and interstitial. They died 9 months after operation.The tumor may occur in the abdomen, pelvic cavity and other sites, with different clinical manifestations. Routine examination should be replaced by immunohistochemical test for correct diagnosis of the tumor. Prognosis of most patients is not good.

FYZghwka.title: Value of ureteroscopic lithotripsy combined with ntrap in treatment of upper urethral calculi:a Meta analysis
FYZghwka.abstract: Objective:To systematically review the effectiveness and safety of ureteroscopic lithotripsy combined with ntrap for upper urethral calculi. Methods:All randomized clinical trials and case-controlled studies of ntrap during ureteroscopic lithotripsy(URL)for upper urethral calculi were identified with PubMed,Cochrane Librily,Embase,WangFang and CNKI. Quality assessments of literatures and data extraction were independently performed by two reviewers. Meta analysis was performed with Revman 5.0. Results:Two randomized trails and 2 case-controlled studies involving 682 patients were collected. Meta-analysis demonstrated that:ntrap group demonstrated a significant advantage over control group in terms of calculi clearance rate(OR=4.28,95%CI=2.51 to 7.28,P=0.000). Incidences of calculi migration and auxiliary lithotripsy were significantly lower in ntrap group than in control group(OR=0.09,95%CI= 0.01 to 0.62,P=0.01;OR=0.18,95%CI=0.05 to 0.67,P=0.010). There was no statistical difference in mean operation time between the two groups(WMD=-0.09,95%CI=-10.25 to 10.06,P=0.990). Conclusions:URL combined with ntrap for upper urethral calculi had higher calculi clearance rate,lower incidence of calculi migration and auxiliary lithotripsy than URL without ntrap.

uFftgmiH.title: Expression and significance of glutathione s-transferase π in human transitional cell carcinoma of bladder
uFftgmiH.abstract: Objective To investigate the expression and biological significance of glutathione s-transferase π(GST-π) in human transitional cell carcinoma of bladder.Methods Immunohistochemical SP method was used to detect expression of GST-π in 81 transitional cell carcinoma of bladder.Results The total positive rate of GST-π was 76.54%(62/81).The positive rate of GST-π in incipient and relapse transitional cell carcinoma of bladder patients were 70.97% and 94.74%,respectively.The positive rate of GST-π was positively correlated to pathological grade and clinical stage(P<0.05).Conclusion The expression of GST-π is correlated with pathological grade and clinical stage,and may be related to anti-tumor drug resistance.

voyJIw6O.title: Efficacy of tamsulosin in treatment of upper ureteral calculi: A meta-analysis
voyJIw6O.abstract: Objective To systematically revise the efficacy and safety of tamsulosin in treatment of proximal ureteral calculi. Methods Electronic search was conducted with PubMed, Cochrane library, EMBASE, Wanfang database, CNKI and VIP to collect randomized controlled trials(RCTs) involving the application of tamsulosin in treatment of upper ureteral calculi. The quality of the included trials was assessed; the data were extracted and analyzed with RevMan 5. 0 software. Results Five RCTs involving 480 patients were identified. The results of meta-analysis showed that, compared with the control group, patients in the tamsulosin group had (1) a remarkably higher stone clearance rate (RR = 1. 25, 95% CI: 1. 12-1. 40, P< 0. 000 1), (2) shorter mean time of calculi expulsion (shortened by 2. 99 days, 95%CI : -3. 61- -2. 37, P<0. 000 01), and (3) decreased incidence of renal colic episodes and mean visual analogue scale pain score (RR = 0. 39,95%CI :0. 26-0. 57, P< 0. 000 01; WMD = -10. 94,95%CI; -21. 30--0. 58, P = 0. 04). Conclusion Our results show that tamsulosin can improve the stone clearance, shorten the mean time for calculi expulsion, decrease the incidence of renal colic episodes and the mean visual analogue scale pain score in patients with proximal ureteral calculi.

t7mBnmku.title: Relationship between varicocele and sperm DNA damage and the effect of varicocele repair: a meta-analysis.
t7mBnmku.abstract: Varicocele, a cause of male infertility, occurs in nearly 40% of infertile males. It has been postulated that varicoceles may cause sperm DNA damage. Sperm DNA integrity has been recognized as one of the important determinants of normal fertilization and embryo growth in natural and assisted conception. Eighty-three human studies were identified after an extensive literature search involving the role of varicoceles in sperm DNA damage. Of the 83 studies, 12 were selected that measured similar types of reactive sperm DNA damage. Seven studies determined the damage of sperm DNA in varicocele-associated patients and six studies evaluated the efficacy of varicocelectomy. One study was a duplicate because both outcomes were included. Data were analysed using RevMan software. The overall estimate showed that patients with varicoceles have significantly higher sperm DNA damage than controls, with a mean difference of 9.84% (95% CI 9.19 to 10.49; P<0.00001). A varicocelectomy can improve sperm DNA integrity, with a mean difference of -3.37% (95% CI -4.09 to -2.65; P<0.00001). In conclusion, there is increased sperm DNA damage in patients with varicoceles and varicocelectomy may be a possible treatment; however, more studies with appropriate controls are needed to confirm this finding. A varicocele is an important cause of male infertility and occurs in nearly 40% of infertile males. The recent understanding of the effect of varicoceles in male reproduction has led some researchers to postulate varicoceles as the possible cause of sperm DNA damage. Eighty-three human studies were identified after an extensive literature search involving the role of varicoceles in sperm DNA damage. Of the 83 studies, 12 were selected that measured similar types of reactive sperm DNA damage by a similar method. Seven studies determined the damage of sperm DNA in varicocele-associated patients and six studies evaluated the efficacy of varicocelectomy. One study was a duplicate because both outcomes were included. The data were then entered in the RevMan software for analysis. The overall estimate showed that patients with varicoceles have significantly higher sperm DNA damage than controls, with a mean difference of 9.84% (95% CI 9.19 to 10.49; P<0.00001). A varicocelectomy can improve sperm DNA integrity, with a mean difference of -3.37% (95% CI -4.09 to -2.65; P<0.00001). Based on the results, it can be concluded that there is increased sperm DNA damage in patients with varicoceles and that varicocelectomy may be a possible treatment; however, more studies with appropriate controls are needed to confirm this finding.

Nqyds81V.title: Comparison study of Faropenem Sodium Tablets and cefuroxime axetil tablets on bacterial infection in urinary system
Nqyds81V.abstract: Objective It is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of Faropenem Sodium Tablets on bacterial infection in urinary system.Methods A total of 125 patients with bacterial infection in urinary system were enrolled into this multicenter,double-blinded,randomized controlled clinical study.62 patients received Faropenem Sodium Tablets as trial group and 63 patients received cefuroxime axetil tablets as control group.Faropenem Sodium Tablets and cefuroxime axetil tablets were orally administered 150 mg and 250 mg respectively third a day.Duration of treatment was 6 to 14 d.Results The cure rates of trial group and control group were 77% and 73% respectively(P=0.565 9),the effective rates were 95% and 100% respectively(P=0.080 5),the bacterial clearance were 96% and 100% respectively(P=0.116 7) and the untoward reaction rate were 2% and 32% respectively(P=0.744 5).There were all no significant differences between the two groups(P>0.05).Conclusion Faropenem Sodium Tablets is effective and safe for the treatment of bacterial infection in urinary system.

lJXmVJd8.title: Effects of circumcision on male and female sexual function
lJXmVJd8.abstract: Objective: To investigate the effects of adult circumcision on male and female sexual function. Methods: Sexual performance of 40 men was evaluated using the Brief Male Sexual Function Inventory (BMSFI) and Intravaginal Ejaculatory Latency Time (IELT) before circumcision and at 4 months after circumcision. And their spouse's sexual function was also evaluated using Female Sexual Function Index (FSFI) at corresponding time. The scores of the BMSFI and the IELT for treated men and the scores of FSFI for their spouse were comparatively analyzed. Results: No significant differences in the mean scores of BMSFI on five sections were found between after circumcision and before circumcision. However, the mean IELT was significantly longer after circumcision compared with that before circumcision. There was no obvious difference in the sexual arousal and orgasm sections after circumcision, significant difference in the scores of lubrication and pain sections of FSFI. Conclusion: Adult circumcision had no effects on male sexual function except increasing the mean IELT. But their spouse might have some negative experiences such as vaginal dryness and pain during sex intercourse after male circumcision. Thereafter, the man with redundant prepuce should have a scientific attitude on adult circumcision treatment.

nw55eP1f.title: Application of modified oblique shorter incision in upper ureterolithotomy
nw55eP1f.abstract: Objective To investigate the clinical application value of modified oblique shorter incision in upper ureterolithotomy.Methods 101 patients with upper ureteral caculi in this hospital from January 2008 to October 2011 were selected and divided into 3 groups,the tradition group(32 cases) by adopting the traditional waist oblique incision,the waist straight incision group(26 case) by adopting the waist straight incision and the modified waist oblique incision group(43 cases) by adopting the modified waist oblique incision for performing upper ureterolithotomy.The effects were compared among 3 kinds of operative patterns.Results The operation time,operative incision size,blood loss volume,leaving bed time,postoperative pain index and calculi mobility showed statistical differences among 3 groups(P<0.05).Conclusion Modified waist oblique shorter incision has the advantages of less damage,little pain,rapid recovery and so on.

vVaVSYee.title: Gene Silencing on hnRNPA2B1 Promotes Apoptosis of Renal Cell Carcinoma Cells
vVaVSYee.abstract: To investigate the effects of hnRNPA2B1 gene silencing on apoptosis of 786-0 cells and its potential mechanism,hnRNPA2B1 shRNA recombinant plasmids were constructed and transfected into renal cell carcinoma 786-0 cells.The effects of hnRNPA2B1 shRNA recombinant plasmids on hnRNPA2B1 gene silencing and the expression of Bcl-X isoforms were detected by RT-PCR.The apoptosis of 786-0 cells were assayed by flow cytometry.MTT method was used to observe the proliferation ability of 786-0 cells.Compared to the control groups,the apoptosis rates of gene-silencing groups were increased significantly while the cell multiplication rates were notably decreased(P<0.05);The mRNA expression levels of pro-apoptotic factor Bcl-X(S) and the ratio of Bcl-X(S)/Bcl-X(L) were increased significantly after the hnRNPA2B1 gene have been silenced(P<0.05).In conclusion,hnRNPA2B1 gene silencing could effectively promote apoptosis of 786-0 cells,the mechanism of which probably relates to its affection on the expression of Bcl-X(S).

0kZQQXYh.title: Clinical study on sinomenine combined with ultrasound physical in the treatment of III chronic prostatitis is pain symptoms
0kZQQXYh.abstract: Objective To explore the effect of Sinomenine combined with Ultrasound Physical in the treatment of Pain Symptoms of El Chronic Prostatitis (CP). Methods Seventy -four El CP patients were equally randomized into a treatment group and a control. The former was treated by Sinomenine combined with Ultrasound Physical, while the latter underwent simple Ultrasound Physical. All the patients were scored on NIH-CPSI and investigated the levels of TNF- α, IL-10 in Expressed Proststic Fluid (EPS) and the therapeutic results were compared between the two groups. Results In the pre- and post-treatment, the total score on NIH-CPSI and that on NIH-CPSI pain symtoms were significantly improved in the treatment group than in the control(P<0.01). The levels of TNF- α, IL-10 in EPS were significantly decreased (P<0.01).with in the treatment group, the score on NIH-CPSI pain symptoms was more significantly improved and The levels of IL-10 in EPS were more significantly decreased. Conelusion Both the combined therapy of Sinomenine combined with Ultrasound Physical and simple Ultrasound Physical are effective, and the former is even more desirable. The levels of IL-10 was directly correlation with the score of pain severity (r=0.55, P<0.01).

63x85V4c.title: Correlation of recurrent pregnancy loss with sperm parameters and sperm DNA fragmentation]
63x85V4c.abstract: To evaluate and compare standard sperm parameters and sperm DNA fragmentation in seminal ejaculates from men whose partners had a history of recurrent pregnancy loss (RPL) and a control group of men who had recently established their fertility.Semen samples from 85 patients with a history of RPL and 20 men with proven fertility were analyzed according to World Health Organization guidelines. Sperm DNA fragmentation was detected by sperm chromatin dispersion test (SCD).A significant difference (P< 0.05) was observed in sperm motility but not other parameters between the two groups. The mean number of sperm cells with fragmented DNA, represented as DNA fragmentation index, was significantly increased in the RPL group [(34.99± 14.62)%] compared with controls [(10.82± 4.80)%].This study has indicated that sperm from men with a history of RPL have a higher incidence of DNA damage and poor motility compared with fertile males.

DyxOSE1i.title: Diagnosis and treatment of primary ureteral carcinoma:report of 23 cases
DyxOSE1i.abstract: Objectve To improve the diagnosis and treatment of primary ureteral carcinoma.Methods The deta of 23 cases of primary ureteral carcinoma were reviewed to evaluate the various kinds of diagnostic means and summarize the diagnostic and therapeutic experience.Results All cases were proved by pathological diagnosis after operation,and 21 cases were diagnosed before operation by B ultrasound,IVU,cystoscopy,retrograde pyeloureterography,CT or MRU.Conclusion Hematuria,unilateral flank pain are the classical symptoms of primary ureteral carcinoma.The diagnostic accuracy of primary ureteral carcinoma might be improved by combined use of various kinds of the diagnostic means before operation.Nephroureterectomy and bladder cuff resection is the best treatment of primary ureteral carcinoma.The prognosis depend on the stage and pathology grade of the carcinoma.

ApEkBbOU.title: Diagnosis and treatment of renal colic in pregnancy
ApEkBbOU.abstract: Objective:To evaluate the pathogenesis and effective therapeutic manners for renal colic in pregnancy.Methods:A retrospective review of 90 patients admitted to our institute was carried out.Correlational data on clinical manifestation,diagnostic imaging,and interventions were analyzed.Results:Among the 90 patients,79 cases(87.8%) were treated by conservative measures.The need for surgical treatment was more prevalent in patients with stone(18.9% vs 2.7%,P<0.05).7cases(7.8%) were treated by placing intraureteral double-J-catheter,and 4 cases(4.4%) by placing intraureteral double-J-catheter after ureteroscopic pneumatic lithotripsy or lithotomy.All pregnant women with renal colic were alleviated and delivered of healthy babies,and went through safely perinatal period.Conclusion:Type-B ultrasonic is a preferred manner of clincal diagnosis at present.Most pregnant women with renal colic can be alleviated by non-surgical treatment.Placement of intraureteral double-J-catheter and transurethral ureteroscopy are effective and safe methods for the treatment of refractory renal colic in pregnant period.

sY55E3c7.title: The effect of long term oral taking low dose aspirin on serum prostatic specific antigen
sY55E3c7.abstract: Objective To investigate the effect of long term oral taking low dose aspirin on serum prostatic specific antigen(PSA).Methods From June 2008 to October 2010,182 outpatients were erolled in the study.54 long term oral taking aspirin patients with cardiovascular diseases were used as aspirin group,128 patients were used as control.Serum PSA level was detected.Results Serum PSA level was significantly lower in aspirin group than in control group(P<0.05).Conclusion Long term oral taking low dose aspirin can influence serum PSA level.

gtEWVKL7.title: Expression of p38 MAPK in rat model with chronic nonbacterial prostatitis
gtEWVKL7.abstract: Objective To study the expression of p38 MAPK in rat CNP model and its relationship with TNF-α, MMP-9,COX-2,p-p38 in the development of CNP.Methods The adult male SD rats CNP model was established by four weeks subcutaneously hypodermic injection with benzestrofol after castration,and other SD rats without pretreat were as controls.The pathological changes of prostate tissue in two groupes were analyzed with H.E.staining.The protein expression of TNF-α,MMP-9,COX-2,p-p38 were examined by immunohistochemistry,and the mRNA level of p38 was detected by RT-PCR.Results Obvious inflammatory reaction was found in prostate tissue of rat CNP model whereas no inflammatory reaction in controls.The protein expression of TNF-α,MMP-9,COX-2,p-p38 in control group were lower than that in model group.There was significant differences in factors mentioned above between two groups(P<0.05).The p38 mRNA level of control group was only 37.3%of that of model group.Conclusion Signal transduction pathway of p38 MAPK might be activated in CNP and the expression of TNF-α,MMP-9,COX-2 might be regulated by p38 MAPK,which provided a new way for elucidating the mechanism of CNP.

7fiZcZ8g.title: Effects of tripterygium wilfordii polyglycosidium on the expression of ICAM-1 and TNF-α in the rat model for nonbacterial chronic prostatitis
7fiZcZ8g.abstract: Objective To study the role of intercellular adhesion molecule-1 (ICAM-1) and TNF- α in the rat model for nonbacterial chronic prostatitis and investigate the effects of tripterygium wilfordii polyglycosidium (TWP) on the ICAM-1 and TNF- α in the rat model. Methods 30 Aged Sprague Dawley rats were randomly divided into three groups:the control group(10 rats), the rat model for nonbacterial chronic prostatitis group(10 rats)and the rat model for nonbacterial chronic prostatitis treated with TWP group (10 rats). The expression of ICAM-1 and TNF- α in rat prostatic tissue was detected by immunohistochemistry(sp). Results (1) The changes in histopathology and patho- physiology in the animal model were similar to those in clinical nonbacterial chronic prostatitis; (2)The ICAM-1 and TNF- α in the rat model for nonbacterial chronic prostatitis group were higher than the control group (P<0.01); (3) Compared with the rat model for nonbacterial chronic prostatitis group, the ICAM-1 and TNF- α in the rat model for nonbacte- rial chronic prostatitis treated with TWP group was abated (P<0.01); (4) A significant positive correlation existed between the expression of TNF- α and that of ICAM-1 in the nonbacterial chronic prostatitis rats (r=0.83, P<0.01). Conclusion The TNF- α and ICAM-1 may play an important role in the development of the nonbacterial chronic prostatitis. TWP may be a new treatment for the nonbacterial chronic prostatitis.

u0JXpwKL.title: Investigation of sexual concept and sexual satisfaction in married women.
u0JXpwKL.abstract: Objective To investigated the statuses of sexual activities, sexual concepts and sexual satisfactions in 2 groups of married women, which were nulliparas with the history of artificial abortions (NAA) and multiparas (MUL), in order to assess the influences of sexual psychological views on the qualities of sexual activities and improve the quality of their marriages. Methods Among 260 randomly selected outpatients in the department of obstetrics and gynecology, we investigated their sexual frequencies, lasting times, and analyzed their questionnaires of Eysenck sexual tolerances as well as sexual satisfactions. Results Compared with MUL group, NAA group had significantly increased sexual frequencies (P<0.001). Questionnaires of sexual concepts and sexual satisfactions showed that a significant interclass differences among education level, occupation and incoming. Conclusions NAA group has open sexual concepts and needed to improve their sexual satisfactions. MUL group has relatively conservative sexual concepts and needs to improve their sexual satisfactions further more. Open sexual psychological views can improve the qualities of sexual activities in married women at different stages. A coupled sexual psychological view can greatly improve marriage quality.

6rjyFRsL.title: Development of a rat model for nonbacterial chronic prostatitis
6rjyFRsL.abstract: Objective To develop a rat model of nonbacterial chronic prostatitis. Methods Aged Sprague- Dawley rats were castrated and injected estradiol benzoate (0.25 mg/ kg/ day, s.c.) for 30 days. Prostates were harvested after 30 days injection. Prostatic tissue was examined histologically for degree of inflammation. Results Different degree of inflammation and lymphocytic infiltration was found in prostate after injection. Conclusion Injection of estradiol benzoate can induce prostatic inflammation similar to clinical nonbacterial chronic prostatitis and it will be a good way to found an animal prostatitis model.

HPqKiYnW.title: Biological characteristics of Colletotrichum gloeosporioides Penz.causing anthracnose of Stylosanthes guianensis
HPqKiYnW.abstract: The biological characteristics of Colletotrichum gloeosporioides Penz.resulting in anthracnose of Stylosanthes was studied.The results showed that the optimum carbon sources of the spore germination was glucose and there was no significant different effect on the spore germination by four treatments of nitrogen sources.The optimum carbon and nitrogen sources of the mycelian growth were sucrose and sodium nitrate.Both the spores and mycelia could grow between pH 3~8.The optimum pH value of the spore germination was 6 and the optimum pH value of the mycelian growth was 8.The lethal temperature of the spore was 50℃ for 10 min.There was no significant different effect on the mycelial growth rate.

Xk63sTYa.title: The significance of mutations in genomic evolution]
Xk63sTYa.abstract: One of the fundamental questions in biological sciences and key problem to be solved in evolutionary biology is that how intra-and interspecific genomic diversity formed, accumulated and preserved in the long history of evolution. It is well known that mutation is the major driving force that has shaped genomes. Moreover mutation research forms the basis for the study of genome evolution. So a full understanding of mutation is necessary to unravel the mechanisms of genome evolution. In the review, we summarize the progress of mutation research and latest development in this field with an emphasis on the property of mutation and its profound significance toward genomic evolution.

SwYRudwg.title: Phenotype and Molecular Analysis of M_1 Generation of Stylosanthes Irradiated by ~(60)Co
SwYRudwg.abstract: The seeds of Stylosanthes guianensis SW.'Reyan No.13' were irradiated by 60Co at 0,325,487 and 974 Gy.Phenotype and molecular variations of Stylosanthes M1 generations were studied.Germination percentage,plant height,leaf length and stem diameter of M1 seedlings were determined using SRAP-PCR.Results showed that biological character indices of treatments were significantly lower than that of control(CK).Irradiation inhibited plant growth.Growth indices of 974 Gy treatment,except leaf length,were significantly lower than CK and other two treatments.Eight effective primers selected from 24 primers combination were used for SRAP-PCR.SRAP analysis revealed that the 57 of 88 DNA fragments were amplified showing polymorphisms.The average percentage of polymorphic bands was 64.77%.The effects of 60Coγ irradiation on DNA variation of seedlings were varied from different treatments.Numbers of polymorphic bands changed after irradiation.Coefficient of variation was in direct proportion to irradiation doses.Variation rates of 325 Gy,487 Gy and 974 Gy treatments were 22.0%,38.1% and 41.5%,respectively.The Nei's genetic similarity coefficient of all treatments was ranged from 0.585 to 0.780 by software NTSYSpc 2.1 based on SRAP results and the average Nei's coefficient was 0.678.The Nei's genetic similarity coefficient of 974 Gy treatment was 0.585 and variation degree was highest among all treatments,487 Gy treatment was second and 325 Gy treatment was the lowest one.Based on present bands,four irradiated treatments were classified into two major groups by UPGMA cluster analysis.GroupⅠincluded CK,325 Gy and 487 Gy treatment and groupⅡincluded 974 Gy.SRAP analysis determinedvariationof Stylosanthes after irradiation and the results of SRAP analysis were consistent with their biological indexes in some extent.

Ido6S1ss.title: Preliminary study on the introduction of Medicago sativa L. WL525 in Guangzhou area
Ido6S1ss.abstract: The introduction and adaptability of Medicago sativa L.in Guangzhou region were investigated.The adaptability expermient with Medicago sativa L.WL522 varieties in Guangzhou region was conducted by three treatment of spray irrigation volume .The germination rate,plant height,branch number ,the ratio of fresh to dry material weight,the ratio of the stem to leaf,phenological period,over-summering rate and over-wintering rate were analyzed.The result indicated that the germination rate,plant height,branching number.over-summering rate and over-wintering rate of medium spray irrigation volume were highest of all there treatments,were 95.30%,55.8cm,20,98.56% and 96.68%,respectively.The ratio of fresh to dry material weight and the ratio of the stem to leaf by low spray irrigation treatment were 23.41% and 56.15%,higher than that of other two treatments.The ratio of fresh to dry material weight and the ratio of the stem to leaf by medium spray irrigation treatment were 24.34%and 50.66%,respectively.All the indexs at high spray irrigation treatment were lowest except that of water content of green leaves .Medicago sativa L.WL522 were growing regular by the three treatment.The average grown rate of medium spray irrigation volume,low spray irrigation volume and high spray irrigation volume were 3.06 cm/d,2.65 cm/d and 2.52 cm/d from April to May,respectively.The result indicated that Medicago sativa L.WL522 varieties were suitable for temperature and soil in Guanzhou,and shown great adaptability by medium spray irrigation and low spray irrigation treatments.

p8Jxf88H.title: Optimization of SRAP-PCR system and its application in genetic diversity analysis of Stylosanthes
p8Jxf88H.abstract: Two different genotypes of Stylosanthes germplasm,S.guianensis cv.Reyan No.2 and S.guianensis cv.Reyan No.13 were used as material for studying the effects of concentrations of Mg2+,dNTPs,DNA polymerase,primers and DNA template on the SRAP-PCR reactions and optimizing the establishment of SRAP molecular marker system in Stylosanthes.The optimum system was established as follows: template DNA 40 ng,Mg2+ 2.5 mmol/L,dNTPs 0.2 mmol/L,polymerase 1 U,primer 0.3 μmol/L,the total reaction volume was 25 μL.The genetic diversity and relationships of nine Stylosanthes germplasms were analyzed by using this optimum system.Forty-eight primers were studied for an analysis of genetic diversity by SRAP in Stylosanthes germplasms.Fourteen effective primers selected from 48 primers combination were used for SRAP-PCR,and 150 of the 154 DNA fragments amplified,showed polymorphisms.The average binds from each primer was 11.0 and the average percentage of polymorphic bands was 97.36%.The Nei's genetic similarity coefficient of the tested accessions ranged from 0.386 to 0.882 by software NTSYSpc 2.1 based on SRAP results,and the average Nei's coefficient was 0.631,average the genetic distance(GD) was 0.369.Based on the presence of bands,nine Stylosanthes germplasm were classified into there major groups by UPGMA cluster analysis,group Ⅰ,group Ⅱ and group Ⅲ.Group Ⅰ included S.hamata cv.Verano,and group Ⅱ included S.scabra cv.Seca.Group Ⅲ included S.guianensis cv.Reyan No.5,S.guianensis cv.Reyan No.10,S.guianensis cv.Reyan No.13,S.guianensis cv.White cook,S.guianensis cv.Reyan No.2,S.guianensis cv.Graham and S.guianensis tardio CIAT1283.This research should provide a scientific basis at the molecular level for further study and the application of nine Stylosanthes germplasms.The most of the varieties with relative relationship in their pedigrees and similar biological characteristics were clustered into the same group.

I5zNHPOO.title: Preliminary identification of the pathogen of Stylo anthracnose disease and assessment of resistance of Stylosanthes spp
I5zNHPOO.abstract: The isolate of Stylo anthracnose in Guangdong was separated,isolated by pure culture and identified,The result based on morphological observations,pathogenetic comparisons and the description of symptom indicated that as follow,The septate hypha was found at the PDA culture medium.The conidium generated on the conidiophores of the acervulus or accumulated was sticky orange spore groups directly on the colony.The conidiophores had no color and parallelly gathered on the acervulus.Produced on the tip of conidiophore,the conidium was of long oval type.Its two ends were blunt with one end a little sharp.The condium was a single cell with no color and included 1～3 oil balls.The width and the length of the conidium were about 12.4～22.5μm×3.2～6.3 μm respectively.The isolate cause disease in many plant hosts,The four cultivars of Stylosanrhes spp.were inoculated by conidial suspensions,The assessment of disease serivity was based on visual estimation of leaf tissue necrosis based on 6 rating scale,and disease index of the four cultivars were significant different.

OnDXVpo9.title: Control effect of three kinds of fungicides against Stylosanthes anthracnose in laboratory and pot experiment
OnDXVpo9.abstract: Stylo santhes anthracnose is the main diseases to restrict the production of Stylo,and chemical control is still the most effective method to control the disease.The result of laboratory test and pot experiment showed that fungal colony growth and conidia germination of S.anthracnose were inhibited by Chlorothalnil 75%WP,Mancozeb 72%WP and Szomega 25 % WP.Inhibitory rate of colony were positive correlation with the concentration of Chlorothalnil and Mancozeb,reached 100% by 1000-fold diluted Chlorothalonil and 700-fold diluted mancozeb,reached more than 95% by 1500-fold and 2 000-fold diluted Chlorothalonil,and reached 100% by treatment three concentration of Szomega at six days sfter treatment.Inhibitory rate of conidia germination were positive correlation with the concentration of the three kind of Fungicides,reached 100% by 700-fold mancozeb and 1 500-fold Szomega,and reached 90.56% by 1 000-fold diluted Chlorothalonil at 36 hours after treatment.The relative control effect of Chlorothalnil was higher than that of two other Fungicides,was 45.84% by 800-fold diluted Chlorothalnil,33.67% by 600-fold diluted mancozeb and 28.43% by 1 000-fold diluted Szomega in pot experiment at seven days after treatment.The relative control effect of Fungicide in laboratory test was obviously less than that in pot experiment.In this study,the relative control effect of Chlorothalni,Mancozeb and Szomega were from high to low order.

uvLcp5O3.title: The Primary Study on Selection High Salt Resistane Hemerocallis middendorfii by Tissue Culture Methods
uvLcp5O3.abstract: The calli were induced by shoot tip of Hemerocallis middendorfii.The results showed that rate of inducing calli of Hemerocallis middendorfii were high by using medium of MS+NAA 0.4 mg/L+6-BA 4.0 mg/L.The growth of tissue culture plant were abserved and proline of tissue culture plantwere determined on the medium added different concentration Sodium chloride.With concentration of Sodium chloride increasing.The experiment showed that the growth rate of tissue culture plant declined,growth of leave were inhibited and the content of proline were increasing.The content of proline of Jiangsu Shuyang was higher that of Hemerocallis fulva var.flore-pleno at same concentration of Sodium chloride.

eVMVlzU0.title: Control effect of zineb,diffenoconazole and prochloraz-manganese against Stylosanthes anthracnose
eVMVlzU0.abstract: Stylo anthracnose is one of the main diseases to damage Stylosanthes guianensis,and chemical control is still the most effective method to reduce the damage.The research result showed that the fungal colony growth and conidia germination were inhibited by Zineb(65% WP),Diffenoconazole(50% WP) and Prochloraz-Manganese(28% WP),in which,the inhibitory rate of colony increased with the concentration of Zineb and Diffenoconazole.After 5 days later,the inhibitory rate reached nearly 100% under the treatment of 3 concentrations of Prochloraz-Manganese.It reached 95.45% under 700-fold diluted Zineb,and 82.13% under 10 000-fold diluted Diffenoconazole.The inhibitory rate of conidia germination was positive correlation with the concentration of 3 fungicides and it reached 100% by 700-fold diluted Zineb,10 000-fold diluted Diffenoconazole and 1 500-fold diluted Prochloraz-Manganese after treatment for 12 hours.However,the inhibitory rate of conidia germination of Zineb and Diffenoconazole decreased after treatment 36 hours.The relative control effect of 3 fungicides was positive correlated with the concentration,and it was 40.20% by 500-fold diluted Zineb,36.62% by 1 000-fold diluted Prochloraz-Manganese and 22.15% by 7 000-fold diluted Diffenoconazole after treatment for 7 days.The relative control effect of fungicide in laboratory test was obviously less than that in pot experiment.

L0kefQiK.title: Responses of defense enzyme activities to inoculation with Colletotrichum gloeosporioides in four cultivars of Stylosanthes spp.differing in resistance
L0kefQiK.abstract: The activities of peroxidase(POD),oxalase oxidase(OXO),polyphenol oxidase(PPO),ascorbic acid oxidase(AAO),chitinase and β-1,3-glucanase were measured by spectrophotometer in four cultivars of Stylosanthes differing in disease resistance,Tardio,CIAT184,TPRC90087 and Graham,following inoculation with conidiospore suspension of C.gloeosporioides.POD activity was highly and rapidly induced in the high and medium resistant cultivars following the inoculation,while that in the disease sensitive cultivar was induced slowly.The PPO activity was induced and maintained at a high level in comparison to the unaltered level in the other three cultivars.β-1,3-glucanase activity was also induced and maintained at a high level for 72 h in the highly resistance cultivar,Tardio,but it was only maintained for 48 h in the medium resistant cultivars,CIAT184 and TPRC90087,compared with the unaltered activity in the sensitive cultivar,Graham.The chitinase,AAO and OXO activity were not changed by inoculation of the four cultivars.It is suggested that the induction of POD,PPO and β-1,3-glucanase activity is associated with the disease resistance to C.gloeosporioides in Stylosanthes spp.

uuUXFF9j.title: Changes in the activities of CAT, SOD and the contents of H_2O_2,callose in cultivars of Stylosanthes spp differing in the disease resistance after inoculation with Colletotrichum gloeosporiodes
uuUXFF9j.abstract: The activities of catalase(CAT),superoxide dismutase(SOD),the contents of hydrogen peroxide and callose were measured in four cultivars of Stylosanthes differing in disease resistance,Tardio,CIAT184,TPRC90087 and Graham, following inoculation with conidial suspension of Colletotrichum gloeos poriodes.CAT activity was induced and increased in the high or mediately resistant cultivars during at experimental period except the susceptible cultivar after the inoculation.It seemed that CAT activity was positive correlated with the cultivar resistance to the disease.SOD activity was induced and increased in the mediate or susceptible cultivars at some experimental period except the high resistant cultivars,SOD activity in the susceptible cultivar was increased higher than that in the mediate cultivars,and the maximum of enzymes appeared earlier than mediate in the resistant cultivars,which seemed that SOD activity was positively correlated with the cultivar re- sistance.The contents of hydrogen peroxide in the high and mediate cultivars reached peak at 24 h when inoculated by the pathogen,and susceptible cultivars reached peak at later time than in other three cultivars.It seemed that defense response in high resistant cultivars mediated by hydrogen peroxide wes induced rapidly and effectively.The contents of callose in high resistant cultivars were nearly three to five times of other three cultivars,which could he related to high cultivar resis- tance.But,there was little change in the callose contents when the mediately resistant cultivar TPRC90087 was inoculated by the pathogen.CIAT184 and Graham could defense pathogen infection by accuamateing callose after inoculated by the pathogen.

i4IwYhs1.title: Stylosanthes guianensis Resistance to Colletotrichum gloeosporiodes Induced by Salicylic Acid and Qxalate
i4IwYhs1.abstract: The effects of salicylic acid and oxalate on induced resistance of Stylosanthes guianensis against infection by Colletotrichum gloeosporiodes were investigated.Salicylic acid at 0.01~1 mmol/L and oxalate at 5~40 mmol/L induced disease resistance,but they showed no difference in inducing disease resistance between disease resistant cultivar and sensitive cultivar.The treatment of 0.01 mmol/L SA had the best induced resistance effects,the effetive percentage was 52.41% to CIAT184,and that was 61.82% to Graham.The treatment of 5 mmol/L Oxalate had the best induced resistance effects,the effetive percentage was 59.92% to CIAT184,and that was 53.93% to Graham.Catalase and polyphenol oxidase activity in pretreated plants with 0.01 mmol/L of salicylic acid or 5 mmol/L of oxalate were decreased in 72 hours after inoculation.Total chitinase activity was not influenced by salicylic acid or oxalate.The endo-chitinase activity was increased in 24 hours after inoculation,while the exo-chitinase activity was decreased.Salicylic acid treated plants had higher β-1,3-glucanase activity than control,but oxalate treated plants had lower β-1,3-glucanase activity than control.It is suggested that salicylic acid and oxalate inhibited CAT activity,which lead to accumulation of H_2O_2,and increased PPO activity,which lead to accumulation of quinone,and thereby induced disease resistance.
